chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Operating While Suspended (Cause Great Bodily Harm)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd D Olson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (3rd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (3rd Offense)], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).
  • Injury by Use/Vehicle-Control. Substance, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.25(1)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Operating While Suspended (Cause Great Bodily Harm)

supervisions.notes: $900 fine plus costs. 60 days to pay fine/costs or set up payment plan with the Clerk of Courts office.

10 days stayed upon attendance at VIP. Sentence can be served in Outagamie County. Defendant is responsible for notifying the Door County Jail if sentence is being served in a different county. Huber release and good time granted. Credit for time served. To commence forthwith.
Any vehicle driven by or registered to Defendant during period of IID restriction must be equipped with Ignition Interlock Device unless otherwise ordered by the Court.

Obtain alcohol assessment through Theda Care Behavioral Health Services and comply with treatment recommendations. Must attend the Door/Kewaunee Victim Impact Panel session scheduled for 2/11/16 at the Justice Center.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (3rd Offense)

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: To pay restitution plus any statutorily authorized surcharges. $1,000 cash bond applied toward restitution.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

03:00 PM Defendant Todd D Olson in court.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DOC Agent Brenda Stohr present in court.  Court reviews events in file, reviews sentence previously imposed. Court questions Agent Stohr on DOC's intent to request civil judgment or extending probation.  Agent Stohr indicates they were going to submit both forms and let the court decide whether to extend or grant civil judgments. Agent Stohr indicates defendant has paid over $4,400 toward restitution, advises defendant has been making monthly payments.  State requests defendants probation be extended, makes statement.  Defendant not objecting to his probation being extended. Court makes statement, extends defendants probation for 1 year. Agent Stohr will submit order for courts signature.
Subpoena and Proof of Service
Probation review hearing on January 18, 2019 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Copy of apology letter from defendant to victim
for DNA Sample

Defendant Todd D Olson in court with attorney Heather Kavanaugh.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts. 4 & 5. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 4 & 5. Court dismisses Cts. 1, 2 & 3 and citations tracking file but reads in for sentencing.   Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge. State/Defense ready to proceed to sentencing without the benefit of a PSI. State/Defense give joint sentencing recommendation. State provides written apology letter from defendant to victim for court to review. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Todd D Olson in court with attorney Heather Kavanaugh.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Kavanaugh asks court to set a plea/sentencing date, has a few matters to work out before entering a plea. State has no objection to continuance.  Bond remains in effect.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 28, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Todd D Olson in court with attorney Heather Kavanaugh.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file. Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limit for prelim. Atty Kavanaugh indicates she hasn't received the file from previous attorney yet, requests a status in 30-45 days.   State indicates defendant has already waived his right to a preliminary hearing and entered not guilty pleas. Court sets status to allow Atty Kavanaugh to get up to speed on the case. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Todd D Olson in court with attorney Sarah Sonia Malcore.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file. Atty Malcore requests to withdraw from the case and have PD office appoint new counsel for defendant. Court grants request. Court reviews added charge in amended complaint including max. penalties. Bond remains in effect.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Status conference at 08-31-2015 11:30 am

Defendant Todd D Olson in court with attorney Greg Gerbers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers has not had any contact with Atty Malcore, not sure if she knew of todays hearing. Atty Gerbers indicates Atty Malcore is not taking any Brown County cases, will still be representing defendants outside of Brown County. Court reschedules matter.  Status conference scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Todd D Olson in court.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Court indicates Atty Malcore has issues going on in Brown County, court is unsure if she will continue to represent defendant. Court reviews added charges in amended complaint including max penalties. Atty Gerbers enters courtroom, indicates new counsel will be appointed to represent defendant. Court reschedules matter. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Todd D Olson in court with attorney Sarah Sonia Malcore.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Malcore indicates matter will resolve short of trial, requests a little more time to research some issues before entering a plea. Atty Malcore requests a status/plea date in 45 - 60 days. State has no objection. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Defense waives speedy trial demand. Atty Malcore requests a status in 60 days. Bond remains as is.

Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Status conference scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 09:00 am.

No contact direct or indirect with N.J.   Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and subject to any conditions or restrictions on that license.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Todd D Olson appears by video conference along with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers who appears by phone.  Joan M. Korb appeared by phone for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for December 1, 2014 at 10:00 am.
